intro: Pimelea lehmanniana var. meiocephala, commonly known as the lemon scented everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers that are often arranged in dense clusters. The plant produces small, woody fruits known as follicles, which contain the seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in heathlands and open woodlands. Its aromatic foliage and long-lasting flowers make it a desirable plant for gardens and ecological restoration projects.
